title: Rooney 'to snub Chinese offers'
text:
Wayne Rooney to stay at Manchester United despite Chinese interest - Sky sources By Sky Sports News HQ Last Updated: 22/02/17 9:13am Wayne Rooney is unlikely to leave Man Utd for a big money move to the Far East before the Chinese transfer window closes next Tuesday, according to Sky sources Wayne Rooney has offers to go to China but is unlikely to leave Manchester United before the Chinese transfer window closes on Tuesday, Sky sources understand. 
Rooney's advisers have been approached by several Chinese Super League (CSL) clubs who are willing to make him the world's best-paid player, offering Â£750,000 a week. 
The clubs include Chinese champions Guangzhou Evergrande, who are managed by Felipe Scolari, and Beijing Guoan, who finished fifth in the CSL last season. 
On Tuesday, Jose Mourinho failed to guarantee Rooney would stay at Manchester United until the end of the season . Wayne Rooney is understood to be the subject of several offers from China 
Rooney has 18 months left on his Manchester United contract, although the club have the option of extending it by another year. 
Under Mourinho, Rooney has become a squad player at United and has not played since February 1 because of a muscle injury. 
CSL clubs are allowed to have only three foreign players in their starting line-ups. Man Utd vs So'ton
